channel.title: How do i get rid of the lag on my server?

item.title: How do i get rid of the lag on my server?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Fr33sc4p3, post:4, topic:80196”]Lag is based on a few things :

[ul][li]The Speed of your computer[/li]
[li]The Speed of your internet.[/li]
[li]The way Private servers were made will mean they will lag always unless a full server rebuild is performed[/li]
[li]And the fact that local internet isnt really good enough for that many incoming connections[/li][/ul][/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: How do i get rid of the lag on my server?

item.title: How do i get rid of the lag on my server?
item.dc:creator: @sp00nkitty sp00nkitty
item.description:
@sp00nkitty wrote:

[quote=“Dell, post:3, topic:80196”]get an antilag.class?
or get rid of globalobjects, and make it into a class…
or get rid of ::pickup and make it a .cfg file…[/quote]yer i have an antilag.class and u tll me how to use it proberly plz

this is wat i have in my antilag.class:

[code]// This resets server every 30 mins to stop lag - spoonkitty
import java.io.*;

public class antilag
{

public int ResetTimer = 0;

public void resetserver()
{
misc.println(“RESETING SERVER!!!”);
misc.println(“Saving all games…”);
PlayerHandler.kickAllPlayers = true;
misc.println(“GAME SUCCESSFULLY SAVED FOR ALL PLAYERS”);
ResetTimer = 0;
closeListener();
runserver();
}
public void process()
{
ResetTimer += 1;
if(ResetTimer >= 99999999)
{
resetserver();
}
}

public void runserver()
{
try
{
String run = “runserver.bat”;
String xstr = “./”+run;
Runtime.getRuntime().exec(xstr);
}
catch (IOException ioe)
{
ioe.printStackTrace();
}
}

public void closeListener()
{
try {
server.shutdownClientHandler = true;
if(server.clientListener != null) server.clientListener.close();
server.clientListener = null;
}
catch(java.lang.Exception __ex)
{
__ex.printStackTrace();
}
}
}[/code]

Read full topic
